data.name: DidNotSelectValidWsForDb
data.value: You did not select a writing system that is valid for this database. Unless you have previously entered data in this database in this writing system, this field will never be shown.

data.name: SaveChangesToCurrentPart
data.value: Save changes to the current part?

data.name: ThisIsConfiguredElsewhere
data.value: This item is configured somewhere else. Hover for details.

data.name: ThisConfigurationIsShared
data.value: This configuration is shared. Hover for details.

data.name: SharesWithTheseNodes
data.value: Configuring the subfields of {0} also affects:{1}.
data.comment: {0} is the name of this node. {1} is a list of affected nodes.

data.name: SeeAffectedNodesUnder
data.value: See {0} for a list of affected nodes.
data.comment: {0} is the node whose tooltip is SharesWithTheseNodes

data.name: ksDisplayComplexFormsInParagraphs
data.value: &Display each Complex Form in a paragraph

data.name: ksDisplayExtendedNoteInParagraphs
data.value: &Display each Extended Note in a paragraph

data.name: Duplicate
data.comment: action on a tree view item

data.name: Delete
data.comment: action on a tree view item

data.name: EditLabel
data.comment: action on a tree view item

data.name: ConfigureReferencedHeadwordsTooltip
data.value: Configure homograph numbers on all headwords and sense numbers on headwords in cross references

data.name: ksFwDummyWndMessage
data.value: The program may quit after the restore has finished. If it does, you can then restart the program on the (restored) project.

data.name: ksReversalIndexView
data.value: Choose the reversal index to configure:

data.name: ksUndoShowSubentryForComponent
data.value: Undo Show Subentry for this Component

data.name: ksRedoShowSubentryForComponent
data.value: Redo Show Subentry for this Component

data.name: ksParsing
data.comment: Label used in progress bar

data.name: ksCustomFieldsCanNotBeAddedDueToRemoteClientsText
data.value: Custom Fields cannot be added when there is more than one connected client.

data.name: ksChooseAnthroCatStartingList
data.value: In Language Explorer, you will use a list of anthropology categories to catalog your entries. Choose a starting list of anthropology categories for this project.

data.name: ksUnableToStartGnomeCharMap
data.value: Unable to start program "{0}". Please install the Gnome Character Map to use this feature.
data.comment: Used if user choose Insert Special character in Linux and the Gnome Character Map software is not installed. Variable is the command to launch Gnome Character Map.

data.name: ksExportingLift
data.value: Exporting Lexicon Items to LIFT Format

data.name: FailedToRename
data.value: Failed to rename. Use a name that is not already in use.
data.comment: String similar 'Failed to rename. Use a name that is not already in use'

data.name: InvalidRootConfigurationNode
data.value: The root node in your configured view is invalid. The field attribute '{0}' must match a class name.
data.comment: low priority for localizing, helpful to developers of dictionary configuration files, hopefully users will never see this.

data.name: Reset
data.comment: Set some dictionary settings back to what they were before customization.

data.name: YouAreResetting
data.value: You are resetting the following to factory defaults:

data.name: View
data.comment: A generic description of a Dictionary View or a Reversal Index View.

data.name: WantContinue
data.comment: whether to continue with the resetting of a configured view

data.name: UploadToWebonaryController_ExportDictionaryContent_Exporting_entries_for_the__0__publication_using_the__1__configuration
data.value: Exporting entries for the {0} publication using the {1} view
data.comment: Displayed in the log when exporting to Webonary. Arguments are: name of publication, name of configured view

data.name: ConfigurationTreeControl_SelectAllChildren
data.comment: Hidden context menu command (Ctrl+Right Click) for selecting a node and all its children in the Configuration Dialog

data.name: ConfigurationTreeControl_ClearAllChildren
data.comment: Hidden context menu command (Ctrl+Right Click) for clearing a node and all its children in the Configuration Dialog

data.name: ksGeneratingDisplayFragments
data.value: Generating the display fragments for individual entries
data.comment: message displayed on progress report dialog

data.name: ksArrangingDisplayFragments
data.value: Putting the display fragments together with the letter headings
data.comment: this message is displayed on a progress report dialog

data.name: ksGeneratingStyleInfo
data.comment: this message is displayed on a progress report dialog

data.name: ksHideGramInfoIfSameAsParent
data.value: Hide subsense grammatical info if same as parent

data.name: YouAreResettingReversal
data.value: You are resetting the following to the 'All Reversal Indexes' settings:

data.name: DictionaryConfigurationMangager_ReversalConfigurations_GroupLabel
data.comment: Label for the group box which contains the reversal configured views

data.name: InadvisableToShare
data.value: It is inadvisable to share '{0}' because a shared node with the same field ({1}) already exists ({2}). No changes have been made.
data.comment: {0} is the node the user has requested to share. {3} is the field these nodes control. {2} is an existing shared node.

data.name: ksDisplayNoteInParagraphs
data.value: &Display each Note in a separate paragraph

data.name: ksStartingWithTheSecondSubsense
data.comment: This directly follows ksDisplayEachSubsenseInAParagraph

data.name: ConfigureHomograph_ConfigDescription
data.value: These settings affect the current {0} view:{1}{2}
data.comment: The first parameter will be either "Reversal Index" or "Dictionary". Second parameter is a newline. Third is the name of the configured view.

data.name: kstidImportingConfigNewName
data.comment: Parameter is the name for a new copy of an existing dictionary configuration.

data.name: kstidImportingAndOverwritingConfiguration
data.value: Importing and overwriting existing view named '{0}'.
data.comment: Parameter is the name of an existing dictionary configuration.

data.name: kstidOverwriteConfiguration
data.comment: Parameter is the name of an existing dictionary configuration

data.name: kstidUseNewConfigName
data.comment: Parameter is proposed new name for a copy of an existing dictionary configuration.

data.name: kstidCannotImport
data.comment: explanation text on import dialog

data.name: kstidImportingConfig
data.comment: Parameter is the name of a dictionary configuration

data.name: kstidChooseFile
data.comment: title of open file dialog for choosing a configuration to import

data.name: kstidImportedSuffix
data.comment: First parameter is the name of a dictionary configuration. Second parameter is a digit. This string is used to generate a unique suffix, like "-Imported3", to append to a configuration name in instances in which a new and unique name needs to be suggested for a dictionary configuration being imported. It would be okay to have spaces in the string.

data.name: kstidZipFiles
data.comment: In configuration import file open dialog, this is the description of what kind of files are *.zip files that are being filtered for.

data.name: kstidConfigsChanged
data.value: Your list of views was just changed. You must close and reopen this dialog to be able to export.
data.comment: Message on message box shown from Manage Views dialog.

data.name: kstidChooseExportFile
data.comment: title of save dialog when exporting dictionary configuration

data.name: kstidConfigsChangedImport
data.value: Your list of views was just changed. You must close and reopen this dialog to be able to import.
data.comment: Message on message box shown from Manage Views dialog

data.name: kstidPublicationsWillBeAdded
data.value: The following publications will be added to the project:
data.comment: Label displayed before the list of any publications that will be added while importing a dictionary configuration view

data.name: kstidCustomFieldsWillBeAdded
data.value: The following custom fields will be added to the project, if not already present:
data.comment: Label displayed before the list of any custom fields that will be added while importing a dictionary configuration view

data.name: DictionaryConfigurationDictionaryConfigurationUser_StyleOverwriteWarning
data.value: Warning! The styles for this project will be overwritten by the import.
data.comment: Warning added to the end of the import information after a user selects a zip file.

data.name: DictionaryConfigurationMismatch
data.value: Error! The file contains a {0} view.
data.comment: Error added to the first of the import information after a user selects a Reversal Index view when we're expecting a Dictionary view, or vice versa.

data.name: ExportSelected
data.comment: Tooltip on dictionary configuration manager dialog

data.name: ImportView
data.comment: Tooltip on dictionary configuration manager dialog

data.name: DeleteViewTooltip
data.comment: Used in Dictionary Config Mgr dialog

data.name: DuplicateViewToolTip
data.comment: Used in Dictionary Config Mgr dialog

data.name: ResetViewTooltip
data.comment: Used in Dictionary Config Mgr dialog

data.name: InvalidUSFM_TextAfterTR
data.value: Invalid USFM: \tr should be followed by \tc# or \th#, but found "{0}". See USFM documentation for help.
